Social Security Disability Attorney

Social Security Disability

Filing for disability benefits is a complicated process, and under Social Security this means total disability, not partial or short-term. There are many types of disability, including: Physical, Visual, Hearing, Mental Health, Intellectual, and Learning disablities.

If you or a family member qualifies for any of these disabilities, contact us for a consultation and we will begin the process to ensure you have a valid claim. As your legal representative, we will gather the evidence, file the correct documents on time, attend all administrative hearings, and discuss all of your options with you. And should your first claim be denied we will appeal your case and fight for your right to be compensated.

Tennessee Social Security Info

In the state of Tennessee, benefits can be paid to disabled adults and children and if you are blind, 65 or older with few resources and little or no income.

Benefits are also based on whether you own real estate, stocks, or bonds, whether you have cash on hand, and the amount of money in your bank accounts. Resources that may be excluded include: your home and the land it's on, life insurance with a value less than $1,500, your vehicle (in most cases), family burial plots, and burial funds for you and your spouse.

Disability Defined

  • No longer able to perform the job you previously did.

  • Unable to perform any other work due to your condition.

  • Your prognosis will last more than a year or result in death.
